metadata.script_title: Managing 34 Projects Simultaneously: The Autonomous System That Saved 16 Hours/Week
metadata.variation: Authority - Positions through scale and proven results

visual_prompts.description: Dashboard showing 34 project tiles, all updating in real-time
visual_prompts.context: When you're managing 34 active projects simultaneously, manual status updates become impossible. You either automate or you drown.

runway.prompt: Sleek digital dashboard: Dashboard showing 34 project tiles, all updating in real-time. Modern UI, glowing elements, dark theme, cinematic lighting, shallow depth of field

kling.prompt: Realistic tech environment: Dashboard showing 34 project tiles, all updating in real-time. Modern office setting, actual screens displaying data, natural lighting, professional workspace

pika.prompt: Modern app interface: Dashboard showing 34 project tiles, all updating in real-time. Vibrant colors, fast transitions, mobile-first design, eye-catching

real_footage.notes: Shows actual working system, builds trust

heygen.script_text: When you're managing 34 active projects simultaneously, manual status updates become impossible. You either automate or you drown.
heygen.notes: Use for intro, key points, transitions

visual_prompts.description: Time tracker showing 17 hours of "project overhead"
visual_prompts.context: Here's what I discovered after burning 17 hours every single week on admin work.

visual_prompts.description: Notification showing "1 issue requires attention" vs. 33 "running smoothly"
visual_prompts.context: You don't need better project management. You need a self-managing system. One that updates itself, tracks everything, and only alerts you when something actually needs your attention.

real_footage.notes: Abstract concept 'Notification showing "1 issue requires attention" vs. 33 "running smoothly"' works better with AI visualization

visual_prompts.context: This system now saves me 16 hours per week. Zero manual updates. Zero spreadsheet work. Just 24 minutes of review time. Let me show you the 3 components that make it work.

visual_prompts.context: > "Build a Python script that: 1) Recursively scans a directory for all CLAUDE.md files, 2) Extracts structured data using regex (project name from ## Project Overview, status from ## Current Status, todos from ## Progress Tracking - Next Actions section, phase from ## Development Environment - Phase field), 3) Outputs to JSON with schema: project_name, path, status, phase, priority, todos array, last_modified, 4) Runs daily at 9 AM via cron, 5) Logs what changed since last run, 6) Includes error handling for malformed CLAUDE.md files."
